overview: From 2025-12-07 to 2025-12-14, elizaos/eliza had 8 new PRs (3 merged), 1 new issues, and 9 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Docs
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
* Build new /docs UI (public, not auth-locked).
* Include:
  * OpenAI-style API explorer.
  * Character setup & API key usage examples.
  * Overview of Cloud architecture.

topIssues.title: Fix Image/Video Tab Functionality
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body: Make sure the Image and Video generation tabs in the Studio are actually hooked up to the backend

topIssues.title: Add "Unsaved Changes" Warning
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body: If a user attempts to navigate away from the Agent Builder without clicking "Save/Deploy," trigger a modal warning them that their agent progress will be lost. Change "save" to "deploy".

topPRs.title: Eliza Cloud Integration, add MCP + A2A service starter, integrate CLI and starter projects tight
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
The goal of this PR is to tightly integrate the elizaos cloud plugin, which now can use cloud as a db and storage provider, and encourage users through the CLI to get up and running with elizaos cloud. CLI should auto log them in, provision API key and make sure project is set up.

Please thoroughly review and understand the create -> deploy -> publish and monetize flow, may still need some work

topPRs.title: Shaw/chore/deslop
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR removes a lot of slop

- Fixes any and unknown and cast types with real types
- Removes try catch
- Removes sloppy comments
- Removes dead files and code

topPRs.title: fix(plugin-sql): optimize pre-1.6.5 migration, RLS handling and SQL organisation
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
# Risks

**Low** - All changes are backwards compatible and idempotent. Comprehensive test coverage added. Nothing is destructive

# Background

## What does this PR do?

- Adds smooth migration from pre-1.6.5 (camelCase) to 1.6.5+ (snake_case) schema
- Optimizes RLS handling: skips disable/re-enable cycle when `ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=true`
- Cleans up RuntimeMigrator: removes dead code, improves table filtering
- Fixes schema indexes and foreign key definitions
- Adds 20+ comprehensive migration tests

## What kind of change is this?

Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes do not require a change to the project documentation.

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?

`src/migrations.ts` - Main migration logic

## Detailed testing steps

```bash
cd packages/plugin-sql
bun test src/__tests__/migration/
```

**179 pass, 0 fail**

topPRs.title: feat: enhance streaming support in text generation
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
# Relates to

- Streaming support for text generation models
- CLI test runner improvements

# Risks

**Low**. Changes are additive and backward-compatible:
- New streaming API is opt-in via `stream: true` parameter

# Background

## What does this PR do?

Adds streaming support for `TEXT_SMALL` and `TEXT_LARGE` model types, allowing plugins to return text incrementally as it's generated. Also fixes several issues in the CLI test runner.

**Core changes:**
- Add `TextStreamResult` interface with `textStream` async iterable
- Add `stream?: boolean` parameter to `GenerateTextParams`
- Add `supportsStreaming()` type guard for model types
- Update `runtime.useModel()` to handle streaming responses

**CLI test fixes:**
- Fix `startAgents` API signature (array of `{character, plugins}` objects)
- Fix `TestRunner` to exclude `@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap` from plugin detection
- Fix unit test mock function name (`getDefaultCharacter`)

## What kind of change is this?

- Features (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes require a change to the project documentation:
- Document the new streaming API for plugin developers
- Update model type documentation with streaming support info

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?

1. `packages/core/src/types/model.ts` - New streaming types
2. `packages/core/src/runtime.ts` - Runtime streaming support
3. `packages/cli/src/utils/test-runner.ts` - Bootstrap exclusion fix
```
